newsitem.title: JAPAN: ASIAN CRUDE OIL SAGS ON IRAQ EXPORT NEWS.
newsitem.headline: ASIAN CRUDE OIL SAGS ON IRAQ EXPORT NEWS.

text.p: Asian crude prices took a brief tumble on Wednesday afternoon after official Iraqi newspapers said long-awaited Iraqi oil exports would enter international markets within the day.

At 0740 GMT, September SIMEX Brent was trading 10 cents down at $18.75 per barrel on the news, with a flurry of late-day activity stemming from the reports quoting Iraqi oil officials as saying a tanker would be loaded with Iraqi crude from the Turkish Port of Ceyhan on Wednesday.
